name: Dwan Smith
comments: Television and film actress, singer and model.

name: Achim Reichel
comments: Musician, producer and songwriter from Hamburg, Germany. He was the frontman of the 1960s group The Rattles.

name: ELF [FI]
comments: ELF (originally called  "Eric Lars Four") was founded in the mid-1960s in Kajaani by Seppo Vuorela. They played as a backing group for several Finnish artists like Laila Kinnunen , Carola [FI] and Katri Helena .  The band released two albums  and a couple of singles In the early 1980s, but after that the band was disbanded.

name: Jean-Claude Pascal
comments: Comedian and singer, who won the 1961 Eurovision Song Contest for Luxembourg with the song "Nous les amoureux". He later represented Luxembourg again in the 1981 with "C'est peut-être pas l'Amérique".

name: The Strange Attractors
comments: Psychedelic rock band from Austin, Texas.

name: All the Saints [US]
comments: Atlanta-based trio All the Saints derive their sound from blues-rock, psychedelia, and early heavy metal.

name: Juice Leskinen
comments: Guitarist, singer and songwriter born in Tampere. He was one of Finland's most important and influential rock stars.

name: Gérard Tempesti
comments: Songwriter, publisher, owner of studio Mastersun (Marseille)

name: Lucy Reed
comments: Jazz vocalist who primarily worked in Chicago.

name: Pat Rooney, Sr.
comments: Choreographer, lyricist, composer, actor, and singer.  His father was a successful vaudevillian, who died when Rooney was young.  At some point, the younger Rooney became known as Rooney, Sr.  He has a son, Pat Rooney, III.

name: Katherine Ellis
comments: Singer-songwriter. Ellis is her married name.

name: Kelly Sweet
comments: Los Angeles based electropop singer and songwriter.

name: Taiska
comments: Pop singer who had her first hit with "Mombasa", recorded in the autumn of 1975. Very popular in the late 1970's and early 1980's, she later became a theatre director while still singing from time to time.

name: The Sea and Cake
comments: Indie rock band with a jazz influence from Chicago

name: Marion [FI]
comments: Singer, who represented Finland in the 1962 Eurovision Grand Prix (now known as Eurovision Song Contest) with the song "Tipi-Tii" when only 16 and again in 1973 with "Tom tom tom".

name: Zepparella
comments: All-female Led Zeppelin tribute band from San Francisco

name: Trío Durango
comments: Vocal trio, originally from the Mexican State of Durango, consisting of the sisters Elia and Alicia Cisneros and their cousin Heberto de Alvarado.

name: Edgardo Cintron
aliases: Edgardo Cintron & The Tiempo Noventa Orchestra

name: Laura Jane Grace
aliases: Laura Jane Grace & The Devouring Mothers
comments: Tom Gabel publicly came out as a transgender in 2012 and started being called Laura Jane Grace.

name: Onegin Gadzhikasimov
comments: Later on, devoted his life to church.

name: Módulos
comments: Progressive and symphonic rock band from Madrid

name: Billy ThunderKloud
comments: Singer born in the village of Kispiox in British Columbia and raised in the village of Kitwanga. Billy was a hereditary Frog Clan Chief, belonging to the Gitksan tribe.

name: Tom Gaebel
comments: Singer and leader of a big band named after himself

name: Arto Sotavalta
comments: Singer and a teen idol in Finland in the late 1960s. He was successful until the early 1980s, when he stopped making music.

name: Jyrki Lindström
comments: Lyricist, translator and an international news correspondent.

name: Runner
comments: Short-lived Anglo-American rock band, who were active between 1977 to 79.

name: Bob Marcucci
comments: Songwriter, talent manager, producer, arranger and co-founder of Chancellor with songwriting partner Peter De Angelis. Marcucci discovered Frankie Avalon and Fabian and helped make them two of the biggest rock ’n’ roll stars of the late 1950s and early 1960s.

name: Marshall Paul
comments: Son of Leonard Chess, founder of the legendary Chicago Blues label Chess.

name: Mary Karlzen
comments: Singer-songwriter and producer from Chicago, now living in Milwaukee.

name: Pete Harris
comments: Country rock singer and acoustic guitarist based in Florida.

name: The Jesus Lizard
comments: Leading underground noise rock band formed in Austin Texas. In 1989 the band relocated to Chicago, Illinois. Reformed in 2008 for a reunion tour.

name: Fun Factory
comments: Eurodance band. It was reconstituted with three different members in 1997.

name: Rhythms del Mundo
comments: Collaboration charity project of Cuban and US, UK and Irish artists (Artists Project Earth - APE), which raises awareness and funds for climate change projects and disaster relief efforts. It was founded by producer & songwriter Kenny Young . The releases feature authorized reworks of original performances, thus credited to 'RdM featuring (original artists)'.

name: A Place to Bury Strangers
comments: Noise rock band from New York

name: Le Volume Courbe
comments: Indie singer-songwriter based in London, UK

name: Hush Arbors
comments: Solo project of singer-songwriter Keith Wood.

name: Michael Janík
comments: Folk singer. Born in Zábřeh na Moravě.

name: Vladimír Poštulka
comments: Lyricist and writer who became a well known food critic. Born in Heřmanice (now part of the city of Ostrava).

name: Natalia Shemyatenkova
comments: Soviet-Russian poetress, writer, lyricist and journalist

name: Nikolai Baskov
comments: Tenor, who performs in both operatic and popular music styles (cross-over tenor)

name: Мурзилки International
comments: Group of radio diskjockeys of Авторадио (AvtoRadio), a Moscow-based radio station: Брагин (Mikhail Geng, actor), Татьяна Гордеева (Elena Loginova, journalist) and Захар (Mikhail Zakharov, economist). They became known for their parodies of songs by popular musical groups or singers.

name: Mikhail Plyatskovsky
comments: Songwriter, poet and playwright born in Yenakiieve (then "Rykovo")

name: Andy Silvester
comments: Multi-instrumentalist best known as a bassist.

name: Yuliy Kim
comments: Bard, composer, poet, songwriter for theater and films

name: Muslim Magomayev
comments: USSR's most famous classical crossover baritone

name: Michael Žantovský
comments: Translator, psychologist, publicist, lyricist, diplomat and eventually even ambassador (Israel, United Kingdom). Born in Prague.

name: Idina Menzel
comments: Actress and singer born in New York City

name: Kuno Lauener
comments: Singer and songwriter from Bern, who performs his songs in Bernese German, a Swiss German dialect.

name: The Remote Viewers
comments: Electro/jazz band featuring saxophones, theremins and synths.

name: Jiří Grossmann
comments: Actor, singer and lyricist, often performed in a theatre. Died in the age of 30 because of Hodgkin's lymphoma.

name: Jackie Fautheree
comments: Rock n' roll and country-pop songwriter and guitarist

name: Sonny Lester
aliases: The 20th Century Strings conducted by Sonny Lester
comments: Lester's career in music began as a trumpet player at big bands.  Lester started Solid State Records as the jazz division of United Artists and turned his attention to record production.

name: Chris Karrer
comments: One of the founding members of Amon Düül II, who led the split from the Amon Düül commune in Autumn 1968 because he preferred to focus on music rather than politics.

name: MC Eiht
comments: Hip-hop artist and actor born in Compton, California

name: Stan Bronstein
comments: Brooklyn, NYC, born saxophonist and singer. Bronstein worked with many artists, a. o. Aerosmith, David Bowie, John Lennon and Tito Puente. As of 2017, Yoko Ono co-founded a fund to support Bronstein's cancer treatment.

name: Rick Frank
comments: Drummer born in New York City

name: Kenny Gamble
comments: Songwriter and producer associated with Philadelphia soul. He was inducted into the Songwriters Hall of Fame in 1995 and received the 2014 Johnny Mercer Award.

name: Hippy
comments: Soul lyricist from Camden, New Jersey

name: Paul Stanley
comments: Heavy metal guitarist, vocalist and songwriter

name: Desmond Child
comments: Songwriter, musician and producer who has worked in many genres of popular music. Child was the songwriter behind such hit collaborations as "Livin' On a Prayer" with Bon Jovi, "Dude Looks Like a Lady" with Aerosmith, and "Livin’ La Vida Loca" for Ricky Martin. Desmond started as a recording artist with his band Desmond Child & Rouge on Capitol Records in the late 1970's co-writing "I Was Made for Lovin' You" with Paul Stanley for KISS. He later became an active board member of ASCAP and the Songwriters Hall of Fame where he was inducted in 2008.

name: Norman Rogers
comments: DJ also known as Terminator X.

name: Joseph Carter
comments: Singer and songwriter from West Baltimore.

name: William Brown
comments: Doo wop singer, songwriter and studio engineer.

name: Tom Bähler
comments: Singer, songwriter, arranger, producer and author from California

name: Louis Johnson [US1]
comments: R&B, soul, funk and jazz bassist

name: Oscar Washington
comments: Songwriter, guitarist, school teacher and record label owner born in Tulsa, Oklahoma.

name: Lewis Simpkins
comments: Co-founder and co-owner of the United label, composer and songwriter. Simpkins was a veteran record man, who previously did A&R for the Miracle and Premium labels and brought many of their former artists to the new label.

name: Harry Akst
comments: Akst started his career in music in vaudeville as a pianist accompanying singers, but ultimately concentrated on songwriting.  He was inducted into the Songwriters Hall of Fame in 1983.

name: Grant Clarke
comments: Tin Pan Alley songwriter and lyricist.  Clarke also wrote songs for film and stage.

name: Hughie Prince
comments: Manager of a radio script agency, soundtrack music composer and songwriter

name: Gene Simmons [Kiss]
comments: Israeli-American musician, singer, songwriter and record producer

name: Herbert Stothart
comments: Songwriter, conductor and composer of film music.  He was nominated for nine Oscars, and won the award for Best Original Score for "The Wizard of Oz".

name: E.Y. Harburg
comments: Broadway lyricist, who was inducted into the Songwriters Hall of Fame in 1972

name: Joe Garland
comments: Jazz saxophonist, composer and arranger best known for writing "In the Mood".

name: Irwin Pincus
comments: Chicago born music pulisher. Under the pseudonym, Allan Jeffrey, he co-wrote "Old Cape Cod".

name: Milt Yakus
comments: Songwriter and father of engineer Shelly Yakus, one of the original owners of Boston's Ace Recording Studios.

name: Linda McCartney
comments: Musician, songwriter, producer, photographer and animal rights activist

name: Gerald Nelson
comments: Songwriter, producer and singer. Known as a frequent writer of songs for Elvis Presley's movie soundtracks.

name: Andreas Carlsson
comments: Pop music songwriter, musician and producer

name: Max Martin [SE]
comments: Music producer, singer and songwriter, who rose to prominence in the second half of the 1990s. He has written or co-written 22 Billboard Hot 100 #1 hits, most of which he has also produced or co-produced. Martin has won the ASCAP Songwriter of the Year award a record eleven times.

name: Judy Parker
comments: Songwriter and collaborator with husband Bob Gaudio.

name: Eddy Marnay
comments: Lyricist and sometimes vocalist. In his career he wrote more than 4000 songs including works for Edith Piaf and Celine Dion.

name: Nellie Lutcher
comments: Blues and jazz pianist, singer and songwriter, who enjoyed extraordinary success in the decade before rock 'n' roll

name: Philip Bailey
comments: Percussionist, lead singer and songwriter Inducted into Songwriters Hall of Fame in 2010

name: George Kerr
comments: R&B and soul singer, songwriter and producer.

name: Teddy Riley [US1]
comments: Producer from Harlem, New York City.

name: Raymond Earl
comments: Soul, funk and disco music bassist and songwriter

name: Scotty Miller
comments: Soul, disco and funk music drummer

name: Clyde Stubblefield
comments: Drummer, best known for his work with James Brown from 1965 to 1971. Stubblefield performed on the funk legend's classic cuts like "Cold Sweat," "Ain't It Funky Now," "I Got the Feelin'" and Brown's landmark LP Cold Sweat and Sex Machine. The drummer's “Funky Drummer” break is among the world's most sampled musical segments.

name: Cleveland Horne
comments: Soul singer and songwriter from Detroit

name: Charles Lloyd
comments: Principally a jazz tenor saxophonist and flautist, Lloyd has also recorded on alto saxophone and unusual reed instruments.

name: 411 [US]
comments: Hardcore band from Huntington Beach, California

name: Raymond Scott
aliases: Raymond Scott and His New Orchestra
Raymond Scott with His Orchestra and Quintet
comments: Composer, pianist and electronic instrument inventor

name: Decibella
comments: Short-lived Trance-project by Spanish producer Alex Garcia Ber.

name: Sharon May Linn
comments: Electro / house music singer, songwriter and producer, who built her career in Italy

name: Denison Marrs
comments: Indie rock Christian band from Florida.

name: Silver Shadow
comments: House and trance music duo, comprising Christopher von Deylen and Mirko von Schlieffen

name: Rinaldo Viana
personal_name: Rinaldo Eliseu Peixoto Viana da Silva

name: Charley Straight
aliases: Charley Straight and His Rendezvous Orchestra

name: Willy Aelvoet
aliases: Willy Aelvoet's New Orleans Swing Band

name: New World
comments: Pop group from Brisbane, that existed from the mid-1960s to the late 1970s

name: Damon & The Heathens
comments: Soul/punk band based in Oakland, California.

name: KiNDERGARTEN
comments: Rock/funk band based in New York City.

name: Tina & The Total Babes
comments: Retro punk/pop band from the San Francisco Bay Area.

name: Morgan Ames
comments: Singer, songwriter, conductor, arranger and writer of album liner notes

name: Rich Cronin
comments: Singer and songwriter, originally from Roxbury in Boston, Massachusetts.

name: Barefoot Jerry
comments: Southern rock and country rock band.

name: Kimiko Itoh
comments: Jazz vocalist who sings mostly in English.

name: Peter Hofmann
comments: Tenor who sang opera as well as rock and pop.

name: Sneaky Pete Kleinow
comments: Pedal steel guitar player who was most recorded as a studio musician for other artists.

name: The Meat Purveyors
comments: Alt Country band from Austin, Texas. Members: Bill Anderson on guitar, Jo Stanli Walston on vocals, Cherilyn diMond on upright bass, and Pete Stiles on mandolin.

name: Curtis Potter
aliases: Curtis Potter and The National Swing Band of Texas

name: Dodie Stevens
comments: Pop singer, best known for her 1959 number 1 hit song and gold record "Pink Shoe Laces", when she was 13 years old.

name: Clara Ward
comments: Gospel and soul singer from Philadelphia

name: Paulo Gilvan
comments: Singer and composer born in Recife

name: Andy Marvel
comments: Songwriter and music producer based out of New York City.

name: Napalm Beach
comments: Punk rock band formed in Longview, Washington that later relocated to Portland, Oregon

name: Peter Lord
comments: Pop, jazz and R&B singer-songwriter, producer and musician

name: Sandra St. Victor
comments: Soul and R&B singer-songwriter, record producer, arranger and pianist

name: No I.D.
comments: Hip hop and R&B music producer from Chicago, Illinois

name: James Poyser
comments: Soul, R&B, hip-hop producer and songwriter from Philadelphia

name: Ida Sand
comments: Jazz singer, keyboardist and songwriter from Stockholm

name: Jutta Weinhold
comments: Rock singer, active since the end of the 1960s

name: Illinois Speed Press
comments: The Rovin' Kind released a few singles before changing it's name when they signed to Epic Records in 1968. Rock group that used elements of R&B and country music.  It was in existence from 1967 to 1970.

name: Josh Ritter
aliases: Josh Ritter & The Royal City Band

name: Those Darlins
comments: Female alt country band from Nashville (TN) fronted by Kelley Anderson, Jessi Zazu & Nikki Kvarnes

name: Deer Tick
comments: Alt-rock band from Providence, Rhode Island

name: Sofia Källgren
comments: Singer and musical artist born in Högsbo

name: The Sparks [US2]
comments: Rock n roll band from New Orleans

name: Vincenzo Russo
comments: Lyricist. He wrote more than 120 songs.

name: Evelyn Evelyn
comments: Musical duo formed by Amanda Palmer and Jason Webley. According to the fictional backstory described by Palmer and Webley, the duo consists of conjoined twin sisters (aka "Eva" and "Lyn"), Evelyn and Evelyn Neville, who were discovered in 2007 by Palmer and Webley.

name: Will Lee
comments: Singer-songwriter and bassist known for his work on The Late Show with David Letterman as part of the CBS Orchestra

name: Jula de Palma
comments: Singer, who started in the early 1950s as a singer on radio. Early in her career she preferred to sing French songs, but she also became famous with her interpretations of jazz classics in English. In 1959 she performed at the "Festival di Sanremo," where she shocked the audience and the press with her passionate performance of the song "Tua." In 1974 she retired from music and moved with her family to Canada. In 2001 she made a brief comeback on Italian television.

name: Katie Hasty
comments: Singer-songwriter; editor and writer for "Billboard" magazine.

name: El May
comments: Indie singer-songwriter and multi-instrumentalist, now based in the US.

name: Bobby Valentino
comments: Violinist, session musician, singer, songwriter and occasional actor and model.

name: Bobby Bluebell
comments: Scottish singer-songwriter and guitarist from Glasgow.

name: Karlie Bruce
comments: Indie singer-songwriter. She is now based in New York City.

name: Dan Donovan [GB2]
comments: British keyboardist probably best known for being a member of Big Audio Dynamite. Following a brief stint in 1990 with The Sisters of Mercy he became a founding member of Dreadzone.

name: Dub Antenna
comments: Dub/electro band based in Nova Scotia

name: Nate Wize
comments: Dub DJ and artist based in Toronto.

name: Citizen Sound
comments: Dub DJ and producer based in Toronto

name: Prince Blanco
comments: Alt/reggae drummer and vocalist originally from the UK.

name: O'Luge
comments: Reggae/dub collaboration between Orville "Wyz" Malcolm and Jeffery Holdip ("Bobby O'Luge").

name: Julius Papp
comments: Canadian-born house music DJ and producer

name: CCCP [NO]
comments: Rock band with members from the US, the UK and Norway.

name: Michael Udelson
comments: Jazz and pop pianist based in San Francisco

name: Pat Klobas
comments: Jazz and classical double bassist based in the San Francisco Bay Area.

name: Ole Friis
aliases: Ole Friis m. Finn & De Fem Fejl

name: Talking System
comments: Modern Talking and Blue System cover band.

name: Gino Cudsi
comments: Singer, songwriter and producer, born in Soudan from a Greek mother and a Syrian father. Half finale contestant at the San Remo Festival 1966, singing "Dipendesse da me".

name: The Forester Sisters
comments: Country music vocal quartet, consisting of of sisters Kathy, June, Kim and Christy Forester

name: Alan Schulman
comments: Grammy award winning record producer, arranger, engineer and songwriter. He is the owner from the Muscle Shoals Sound Studios in Sheffield, Alabama

name: Dirty on Purpose
comments: Pop/shoegazer band based in Brooklyn, New York.

name: The Dreaming
comments: Goth band from Los Angeles, California. Signed with Epochal Artist Records in 2011.

name: Geoff Love
aliases: Geoff Love and His Ragtime Band
Manuel and His Music of the Mountains
Manuel and The Music of the Mountains
Manuel & The Music of the Mountains

name: Chris Evans-Ironside
comments: Keyboarder, songwriter, score and theatre play music composer, producer and arranger partly appearing as just Chris Evans. He lived and worked in Hamburg, Germany, since the early 1970s, collaborated with a number of artists, signed co-responsible for many hits and collected gold and platinum awards.

name: Lynn Ahrens
comments: Writer and lyricist for the musical theatre, television and film

name: Wanderléa
comments: Singer from Minas Gerais, but her family moved near Rio when she was 10 years old

name: Ronnie Tober
comments: Singer, active since the end of the 1950s. He was born in Bussum, but moved to the US when he was three and spent his whole childhood in Albany, New York and did not return to The Netherlands until he was 19 in 1964. His first single  - the cover song Iedere avond in carefully accented Dutch - was a #11 hit in The Netherlands and he has been active ever since.

name: KSM
comments: All-girl rock band from Los Angeles, California active from 2006 to 2010.

name: Agnes Obél
comments: Singer, songwriter and musician, based in Berlin, Germany

name: Ken "Duro" Ifill
comments: CEO of Desert Storm Records and a six-time Grammy Award-winning mix engineer.

name: Benighted
comments: Black metal band from Saint-Étienne, Auvergne-Rhône-Alpes

name: The Simple Carnival
comments: Vocalist, multi-instrumentalist and instrument inventor from Pittsburg, Pennsylvania

name: Emilie Mover
comments: Indie singer-songwriter and guitarist from Toronto

name: Thomas Brinkmann
comments: Producer of experimental minimal techno music

name: Mutual Admiration Society
comments: Country / bluegrass music project, a collaboration between Nickel Creek and Glen Phillips

name: Catherine Russell
comments: Jazz and blues vocalist, daughter of pianist/orchestra leader/composer/arranger Luis Russell, and bassist/guitarist/vocalist Carline Ray.

name: Marion Mann
comments: Big band vocalist and a onetime regular on "The Breakfast Club", the NBC radio show (1933-1968).

name: The Hour of Charm All Girl Orchestra
aliases: Hour of Charm All Girl Choir
The Hour of Charm All Girl Orchestra and Choir
comments: Full orchestra featured in the "Hour of Charm" radio show (1934-1948).

name: Harry Tierney
comments: Composer who wrote for musicals and had major successes in the 1910s and 1920s, including "Irene". Inducted into the Songwriters Hall of Fame in 1970.

name: Columbia Light Opera Company
comments: This name was applied to a constantly changing lineup of performers, mostly studio singers, recording for the record label Columbia .

name: Frankie Masters
aliases: Frankie Masters and His Orch. - Vocal Chorus by Frankie Masters and The Masters Voices
Frankie Masters and His Orchestra - Vocal by The Swing Masters
Frankie Masters and His Orchestra - Vocal Chorus by Frankie Masters
Frankie Masters and His Orchestra - Vocal Chorus by Frankie Masters and The Masters Voices
Frankie Masters and His Orchestra - Vocal Chorus by Frankie Masters & The Masters Voices

name: Ozzie Nelson
aliases: Ozzie Nelson and His Orchestra - Vocal Chorus by Ozzie Nelson
Ozzie Nelson and His Orchestra - Vocal Refrain by Ozzie Nelson
comments: Bandleader and later creator and star of "The Adventures of Ozzie and Harriet", originally a radio show that became a television series.

name: Coot van Doesburgh
personal_name: Jacoba Dorothea Semeijns de Vries van Doesburgh

name: De kinderen von Trapp
comments: Collective of all the Dutch children, who have played in the various Dutch productions of the musical The Sound of Music .

name: Gordon [NL]
comments: Singer and television personality. In 1991 he had a Dutch #1 hit with the single "Kon ik maar even bij je zijn".

name: Carlo Alberto Rossi
comments: Composer, musician, music publisher and producer

name: Ferhat Göçer
comments: Pop and opera singer and doctor

name: Rick Saucedo
comments: Elvis Presley impersonator, singer, musician and songwriter.

name: Julia Murney
comments: Singer-actress with credits in many off-Broadway productions

name: Glen Larson
comments: In his youth, Larson was a pop vocalist in The Four Preps, as well as a songwriter.  He went on to a career as a producer and writer for television.  He was the creator or co-creator of such popular American series as "Quincy. M.E.", "Knight Rider", and "Magnum, P.I.".

name: Zombies of the Statosphere
comments: New York City-based powerpop and psychedelia

name: Five Iron Frenzy
comments: Christian ska band based in Denver. Formed in 1995, originally disbanded in 2003 and reunited in 2011

name: Fred Rogers
comments: Creator and host of the educational children's TV show "Mister Rogers' Neighborhood". He also wrote songs for the program.

name: The Sundowners [GB2]
comments: Rock 'n' roll band from Hastings in Sussex, fronted by Lee Gocher

name: Gerard Masters
comments: New Zealand-born jazz/rock/funk pianist. His trio is a traditional jazz grouping.

name: Jo Basile
aliases: Joss Baselli à l'accordéon et son ensemble
Joss Baselli au vibraphone et ses solistes
comments: Accordionist, vocalist, composer and music publisher. He married Josette Viseur.

name: Blenderhead
comments: Punk/emo band. Disbanded in 1995; re-formed in 2000.

name: Dixie Power Trio
comments: New Orleans band using traditional instruments to play a wide variety of musical genres. They still call themselves a trio despite having four members.

name: The Exies
comments: Rock band based in Los Angeles. Formed in 1997.

name: Susan Hamlin
comments: Folk-style singer and guitarist based in Saratoga Springs, New York

name: Billy Iuso
comments: Funk and rock singer-songwriter and guitarist based in New Orleans, Louisiana

name: Giovanni D'Anzi
comments: Musician, singer, composer and lyricist, who sometimes for translations used the alias Notorious.

name: Alida Valli
personal_name: Alida Maria Altenburger baronessa von Markenstein und Frauenberg

name: Mónica Naranjo
comments: Singer, songwriter, music producer and presenter who was born in Figueres, Gerona, Catalonia

comments: Musician and songwriter, who has written songs for artists such as Mia Martini, Mina, Patty Pravo, Fausto Leali, Edoardo Vianello, and Franco Califano.

name: Cristóbal Sansano
comments: Songwriter, arranger, producer and founder of Sansound S.L. production company, born in Elche, Alicante

name: Pet Engine
comments: Indie/power pop band from Milwaukee, Wisconsin.

name: Alex Ballard
comments: Americana musician based in Milwaukee, Wisconsin

name: The Blow Pops
comments: Indie pop band based in Milwaukee

name: Wooldridge Brothers
comments: Country rock/pop duo based in Milwaukee

name: The Loyal Order of Water Buffalo
Tim Kerr
comments: Punk rock and rock guitarist, singer, and producer. Outside of the music business, he is a visual artist. Inducted into the Texas Music Hall of Fame in 1996.

name: Willy Porter
comments: Folk music singer-songwriter and guitarist based in Wisconsin.

name: The Morning Benders
comments: Indie Rock: Christopher Chu, Julian Harmon, Timothy Or, Jonathan Chu.

name: Rufus
comments: Funky band from Chicago. Also known for launching joining vocalist Chaka Khan 's career. Triple Grammy winners (1974,1978,1983) and nominated for Rock & Roll Hall of Fame induction in 2011. Not to be confused with the Australian act Rüfüs and bands called Ruphus.

name: Edita Piekha
comments: Born in France, raised in Poland, famous in Russia.

name: Klezmer Conservatory Band
comments: Boston based band featuring traditional klezmer music

name: City Lights
comments: Pop punk band from Columbus, OH

name: You, Me, and Everyone We Know
Scott Bradoka
comments: Jazz fusion guitarist, songwriter and producer

name: Yevhen Hrebinka
comments: Ukrainian writer and poet who created works in both Ukrainian and Russian. Russian spelling: Евгений Павлович Гребенка (Evgenij Pavlovich Grebenka).

name: Alix Combelle
aliases: Alix Combelle et son grand orchestre
comments: Swing jazz saxophonist and clarinetist. He recorded often with Django Reinhardt and the Quintette du Hot Club de France.
A dance-punk band that formed in Sacramento, California, in 1996 by lead singer Nic Offer. Its name is most commonly pronounced "Chk Chk Chk".

name: Natasha Alexandrovna
comments: Dance/house music artist, originally from Moscow. She moved to Italy and then to North America to pursue a recording and modeling career. She settled in Los Angeles.

name: Михаил Вавичъ
comments: Romanized name: Mikhail Ivanovich Vavich. Bass vocalist known for his work in operettas and as a movie actor.

name: Pat Suzuki
comments: Singer and actress, who is best known for her role in the original Broadway production of the musical Flower Drum Song and her performance of the song "I Enjoy Being a Girl" in the show.

name: B.J. Baker
comments: Backing singer and a producer / director for backing singers

name: Paul Klein [US1]
comments: Composer, who worked with lyricist Fred Ebb from the early 1950s onward contributing songs to the cabaret revue "Isn't America Fun" (1959) and the Broadway revue "From A to Z" (1960)

name: Betty Johnson
comments: Pop vocalist, well known in the 1950s with frequent appearances on radio's "Breakfast Club" and TV's "Tonight Show". She began performing again in 1993 after becoming largely inactive musically in the mid-1960s.

name: Patty Morabito
comments: Pop vocalist with many credits in theater and as a cabaret singer

name: Andrés Calamaro
comments: Singer-songwriter, musician, composer and record producer

name: Mark May
comments: Blues-rock vocalist and guitarist based in Houston, Texas

name: Henk van Broekhoven
personal_name: Andreas P. C. J. van Broekhoven

name: Wiseman Sextette
comments: African American vocal group (four males, two females) that recorded for Rainbow

name: Norfolk Jazz Quartette
comments: Male vocal harmony group that released dozens of records between 1921 and 1940, primarily labeled as the Norfolk Jubilee Quartette. The Jazz Quartette name was used when the group recorded non-religious material.

name: Dave McKenna
comments: Jazz pianist influential particularly for his solo recordings

name: Goldee Heart
comments: R&B / pop vocalist and keyboardist based in Richmond, Virginia

name: Doug Earley
comments: Smooth jazz saxophonist based in Southern California

name: Martin Turner
comments: Bass guitarist, lead vocalist and founding member of the rock band Wishbone Ash.

name: Jimmy Robbins
comments: Singer-songwriter and producer born in Raleigh, North Carolina

name: Dee Fisher
comments: Fisher was the manager of the Wurlitzer organ store on Main Street at Disneyland. He would play music from Disney movies as patrons were leaving the amusement park at closing.

name: Arthur Russell
comments: Creative avant-garde composer, singer-songwriter, cellist and disco producer. Russell died of AIDS-related illnesses at the age of 40.

name: Kenny Wheeler
comments: Trumpet player and composer.  Wheeler is most frequently heard in post-bop and avant-garde jazz settings, but he has also recorded free improvisation and rock.  He is a recipient of the Order of Canada.

name: George Cables
comments: Jazz pianist who most frequently is recorded playing bop

name: Warren Gale
comments: Jazz trumpet player and educator from Richmond, California

name: Eddie Marshall
comments: Jazz drummer - not to be confused with Eddie Marshall the reed player.  He has also taught drums both privately and in university jazz programs.

name: Mel Martin
comments: Known best as a tenor saxophonist, Martin is a multi-instrumentalist

name: Haste the Day
comments: Christian metalcore band from Carmel, Indiana

name: Jax [GB]
comments: House music duo of Jason Sepala and Alex Melekkis

name: Rafael Méndez
aliases: Rafael Méndez and His All-Star Jazz Orchestra
Ralph Mendez His Trumpet and His Orchestra
comments: Virtuoso trumpeter. Moving to the US in the mid-1920s to work in non-music jobs, he began playing with several orchestras and quickly became an in-demand featured soloist.

name: Deanna Durbin
comments: Canadian-born singer-actress. Beginning her movie career at age 14, she became well known early on for her operatic vocal style. Movie director Charles Henri David was the third husband to Deanna Durbin. They married in December 1950, after she had lived with him in France for eight months. They settled in France and stayed married until his death (March 1, 1999), having one child (born in 1951).

name: Turtle Island String Quartet
comments: Jazz string quartet based in San Francisco

name: Paquito D'Rivera
comments: Jazz/Latin music woodwinds player, now based in the US

name: Peter Appleyard
comments: Jazz vibraphonist born in England, but who has lived in Canada most of his adult life.  In fact, he is a recipient of the Order of Canada.

name: Charles Bell
aliases: Charles Bell and the Contemporary Jazz Quartet
comments: Jazz pianist and composer from Pittsburgh, Pennsylvania

name: Johnny Brandon
comments: English singer and songwriter, who was popular during the 1950s and recorded for a number of labels. His perennial backing group was known as The Phantoms. He later composed several off-Broadway musicals including "Cindy" (1964) and "Billy Noname" (1970). In 1979 he was jointly nominated for a Tony Award for Best Original Score for his work on "Eubie!".

name: Euday Bowman
comments: Texas-born ragtime/blues pianist and songwriter. His "12th Street Rag" is by far his most famous work.

name: Earl Fuller
comments: Dance band bandleader, pianist and drummer born in Stonington, Illinois

name: The Six Brown Brothers
comments: Novelty band consisting of six saxophonists. While there were six real brothers, not all played together in every recording, not all members were necessarily one of the Browns. Their popularity ignited a "saxophone craze" circa 1910 with many copycat bands.

name: All Star Trio
aliases: All Star Trio and Their Orchestra
comments: Piano/saxophone/xylophone dance combo formed in 1918. One of the earliest to make what are now considered jazz recordings.

name: Black Cat Bones
comments: Blues rock group who released their sole album after several years' touring. Members went on to join Free , Foghat and Leaf Hound .

name: Bennie Moten
comments: Pianist and leader of an all African American band that enjoyed great popularity in its time. After his untimely death at age 39, leadership of the band was taken over by William "Count" Basie and was eventually renamed. Not to be confused with the jazz bassist Benny Moten.

name: Sol Hoopii
aliases: Sol Hoopii and His Hawaiian Trio
Sol Hoopii and His Novelty Five
Sol Hoopii and His Novelty Quartette
Sol Hoopii and His Novelty Trio

name: Fraser MacPherson
aliases: The Fraser MacPherson Quintet, featuring Ian McDougall
comments: Multi-instrumentalist whose primary instrument was the tenor saxophone and was particularly known for his jazz of the cool school.

name: Peter Van Os
comments: Belgian singer, mostly active in the 1950-60s

name: Manhattan Jazz Quintet
comments: Jazz group formed in 1983.  It is very popular in Japan, and the vast majority of its releases are on Japanese labels.  The group is not well known outside of Japan.

name: Feodor Chaliapin
comments: Bass opera vocalist, who gained international recognition after becoming an expatriate following the chaos of the Russian Revolution. His son Feodor Chaliapin Jr. was an actor.

name: Don Sebesky
aliases: Don Sebesky & The Jazz Rock Syndrome
comments: Originally a trombonist, he stopped playing when he concentrated on composing and arranging.  On records released under his name, he has played piano or other keyboards or restricted his role to musical director.

name: The Polyjesters
comments: Eclectic acoustic-electric band led by the Valleau brothers from Alberta

name: Emmett Miller
aliases: Emmett Miller (Acc. by His Georgia Crackers)
Emmett Miller acc. by His Georgia Crackers
Emmett Miller accompanied by His Georgia Crackers
Emmett Miller Assisted by Dan Fitch
Emmett Miller and His Georgia Crackers
comments: Minstrel show performer, whose falsetto singing style that included yodeling influenced country music artists of the 1940s

name: Nichole Alden
comments: Singer-songwriter based in Los Angeles with many credits in movie soundtracks and commercials

name: PCA Problems
comments: House music project formed in Valencia. Active from 1993 till 1995.

name: Casey Mecija
comments: Multi-disciplinary artist and musician, who has been active in Toronto's music and cultural scene.

name: The Rest
comments: Indie rock band from Hamilton, Ontario

name: The Real Tuesday Weld
comments: The Real Tuesday Weld is the band identity of singer/songwriter Stephen Coates.

name: Papercuts
comments: Indie pop band from San Francisco, CA centered around songwriter Jason Robert Quever

name: Abel Baer
comments: Songwriter from Baltimore, who gave up his early career in dentistry in 1920 to join a music publisher as a staff writer, collaborating with many other popular songwriters.  Moving to Hollywood in 1929, he contributed songs to several movies. He also collaborated on Broadway musical theatre scores.

name: Moonshine Still
comments: Fusion jam band formed in Macon, Georgia.

name: Exit Clov
comments: Indie pop/rock band from Washington, D.C.

name: Delta Nove
comments: Rock/roots music band from Long Beach, California.

name: Jessica Lurie
comments: Saxophonist and vocalist based in New York City.

name: Hairy Apes BMX
comments: Eclectic indie band from Austin, Texas.

name: Umphrey's McGee
comments: Progressive rock jam band based in Chicago

name: The New Up
comments: Pop rock band based in San Francisco.

name: Dark Star Orchestra
comments: Grateful Dead tribute band, based in San Francisco.

name: Die Wiener Sängerknaben
comments: Follows in the footsteps of traditional boys' choirs that were supported by the Austrian monarchy for the purpose of singing religious music.

name: Edgar Fairchild
comments: Fairchild both performed and recorded as a pianist -- both as a leader and as an accompanist.  He also recorded piano roles for player pianos.  As a composer, his music has appeared both on Broadway and in films.

name: Deep Sweden
comments: Alt band from Prague incorporating cello and violin.

name: Wild Nothing
comments: Indie-pop solo project of Jack Tatum, active since 2009.

name: Anthem In
comments: Pop/rock band from Brooklyn (New York City)

name: Jerry Gray
comments: Violinist, composer, arranger, best known for his work with Glenn Miller

name: Ariel Aparicio
comments: Cuban–American pop-rock singer based in Brooklyn, New York City.

name: Sal Salvador
aliases: The Sal Salvador Quartet with Brass

name: Sathima Bea Benjamin
comments: Singer, composer, and lyricist Benjamin was born and lived in South Africa until her early adulthood. She has subsequently lived in Europe, New York City and South Africa.

name: Danielz
comments: Member of T.Rex tribute band T.Rextasy

name: Koivistolaiset
comments: Duo formed by two sisters, Anja and Anneli Koivisto. They represented Finland in the Eurovision Song Contest in 1971 with Markku Aro .

name: Claes af Geijerstam
comments: Musician, radio personality and DJ who is most famous for his talent of rapid speech and his many years as a radio DJ.  He was part of the pop group Ola & the Janglers in the 1960s and formed the group Malta (later renamed Nova) together with Göran Fristorp.

name: Kipparikvartetti
aliases: Kipparikvartetti ja  Georg de Godzinsky orkestereineen
comments: Vocal quartet, initially under the direction of Harry Bergström and later - from 1956 onwards - George de Godzinsky. The group was initially formed in 1950 only to sing in the film "Kaunis Veera eli ballaadi Saimaalta" but became more permanent due to popular demand. It continued performing and recording (with some personnel changes) until 1983.

name: Ismo Kallio
comments: Actor born in Turku, who had a short singing career in the 1960s.

name: Natalie McDonald
comments: McDonald was former editor and publisher of a T. Rex fan magazine in 1974-75 based in America which became so established that it replaced the Official fan club newsletters, financed by Bolan’s own Wizard Publishing Co.

name: Jedrzej Dmochowski
comments: Songwriter, guitarist teacher and charity director

name: The Acid Casualties
comments: Harold Bronson project  to attempt to take advantage of contemporary recording techniques in revisiting the sound of the psychedelic bands of the Sixties

name: Curtis Counce
comments: Jazz double bassist.  Many published sources give Counce's date of birth as January 23, 1926.  The California death index uses the date shown.

name: Red Holloway
comments: Blues and jazz tenor saxophone player

name: Art Mooney
aliases: Art Mooney and The Dixieland All-Stars
Art Mooney and His "Everybody Join In" Orchestra & Chorus
Art Mooney and His Orchestra and Chorus
Art Mooney and His Orchestra – Vocal by Art Mooney Choir
Art Mooney and His Orchestra - Vocal by The Ensemble
Art Mooney and His Orchestra - Vocal by The Ivys

name: Althea René
comments: Soul Jazz flutist from Detroit, Michigan

name: George Duning
comments: Musician, arranger and composer. He created many film and television scores, with his best known works dating from the 1950s with five Academy Award nominations.

name: Stan Wrightsman
comments: Jazz pianist born in Gotebo, Oklahoma

name: Kip Anderson [US]
comments: R&B, blues and soul singer and songwriter

name: Sheila Jordan
comments: Jazz vocalist and songwriter, working bop and free jazz idioms and often scatting

name: Joe LoCascio
comments: Jazz pianist based in Houston, Texas.

name: Rafael Gastón Pérez
comments: Songwriter and musician, a major figure in Nicaraguan music.

name: Superblue
comments: Jazz super group extant in the late 1980s.

name: Mickey Tucker
comments: Tucker's principal instrument is piano, but he has also recorded on organ.  In his early career, he was a sideman in various R&B groups, but he switched to jazz in the late 1960s.

name: Hildegard Maria Rauchfuß
comments: Author, whose output included novels, short stories, poems, song and cabaret lyrics, radio plays and television dramas

name: Victor Brox
comments: Blues musician and multi instrumentalist from Manchester

name: Tom Heyman
comments: Singer/songwriter who started playing in the late 1980s with the Philadelphia-based band Go to Blazes. After relocating to San Francisco in 1998, he was working as a sideman for The Court and Spark, Chuck Prophet, John Doe, Alejandro Escovedo, Hiss Golden Messenger, and many others. Since 2000, Tom Heyman has released seven solo albums.

name: Walter Pidgeon
comments: Canadian-born actor and singer famous for his distinctive baritone voice. His film career began with silents and continued through the early 1970s.

name: George M. Cohan
comments: Singer, actor, dancer, songwriter and producer. He wrote hundreds of songs, and also created many stage musicals beginning with "Little Johnny Jones" in 1904. He is regarded as the father of American musical comedy. Inducted into the Songwriters Hall of Fame in 1970

name: Pert Kelton
comments: Stage, movie, radio and television actress, largely in comedy roles.

name: Ron Howard
comments: Famous as a child actor with his best known role as "Opie" in the "Andy Griffith Show" television series. His appearance in the movie version of "The Music Man" may be his only singing role. After a nearly 20 year career in acting, he became a director, eventually making many major films.

name: Eddie Palmieri
comments: Pianist who plays jazz, Latin jazz, and salsa.  Palmieri's parents immigrated to New York City from Puerto Rico, and Palmieri has sometimes been called "the Latin Monk".

name: Scott Dreier
comments: Vocalist specializing in musical theater and standards

name: Jason Harms
comments: Jazz/swing vocalist and guitarist based in Minneapolis, Minnesota.

name: Andrew White [US]
comments: Multi-instrumentalist, leader and sideman in classical, R&B and jazz projects.  As a leader he has mostly recorded on saxophone.  White is also a musicologist who has transcribed and published through his own "Andrew's Music" over 700 transcriptions of John Coltrane solos.  In his capacity as a musicologist, he is known as the "Keeper of the Trane".

name: Nico Gomez
aliases: Nico Gomez et son orchestre typique
Nico Gomez and His African Percussion Inc.
Nico Gomez and His Top Orchestra
comments: Amsterdam-born guitarist and orchestra leader based in Brussels from 1947 onwards

name: Northern Lights
comments: Progressive bluegrass band from the New England area that's had myriad of members over the years.

name: The Brook Brothers [GB]
comments: Pop duo, consisting of brothers Geoff and Ricky Brook

name: Helen Miller
comments: Songwriter and producer Helen Miller started her career in music in the late 1940s in New York City. She successfully wrote pop and R&B hits ranging from major hits for Dinah Washington and hits for Lesley Gore, Gene Pitney and The Shirelles.

name: Bill & Boyd
comments: Pop duo, active in the 1960s and 1970s.

name: Arthur Lipner
aliases: Arthur Lipner and the World Jazz Group

name: The Buffalo Bills
comments: Barbershop quartet from Buffalo, New York. Credited individually in "The Music Man" as one regular member was replaced.

name: Alive 'n Kickin'
comments: Pop-rock band from Brooklyn (New York City) showcasing the talents of drummer Vito Albano, vocalist Sandy Todler, guitarist John Parisio, keyboardist Bruce Sudano and bassist Thomas Wilson.

name: Deanna Bogart
comments: Blues/roots music vocalist, pianist and saxophonist.

name: Arabella Hong
comments: Singer-actress with both pop and classical performances to her credit

name: Frank Signorelli
comments: Jazz pianist, songwriter and founder of the Original Memphis Five with trumpeter Phil Napoleon in 1917.

name: Paul Bley
aliases: The Paul Bley Quartet featuring Dave Pike
comments: Born in Montreal, Quebec, Bley, a jazz pianist and composer, has long resided in the United States.

name: Georges Blaness
aliases: Georges Blaness con su gran orquesta

name: Tubby Hayes
comments: Jazz musician; he played saxophones, vibes, and the flute, but he is best remembered as a tenor saxophonist.

name: Griff Steel
aliases: Griff Steel & The Duck 'n' Dive Five

name: The Unauthorised Version
comments: Seven-man vocal pop-sike group comprising past or present members of Oxford University's Magdalen College choir.

name: Charles Winninger
comments: Singer-actor. He was a familiar character actor in his later years.

name: Rita MacNeil
comments: Country and folk singer from Big Pond, Nova Scotia.

name: Joel Weiskopf
comments: Jazz pianist from Brooklyn (New York City).

name: Jean Shy
comments: Rhythm 'n' blues, soul and disco singer from Chicago.

name: Bostonians
comments: A cappella vocal group from Boston College

name: Christian Dozzler
aliases: Christian Dozzler and The Blues Wave
comments: Blues multi-instrumentalist now living in Texas.

name: Richie Rome
comments: Pianist, arranger and composer from South Philadelphia.

name: Adachi Kyodai
comments: Acoustic singer-songwriter duo, the two brothers Ryusuke and Source "K" (Sosuke) Adachi.

name: Win Marcinak
comments: Singer-songwriter and dancer fro the San Francisco Bay area.

name: Leroy Holmes
aliases: Leroy Holmes and His Orchestra and Chorus
LeRoy Holmes, His Orchestra and Chorus
Leroy Holmes and His Tug Boat Eight
The M-G-M Strings conducted by Leroy Holmes
comments: Songwriter, arranger and conductor. He provided backing music on many pop records in the 1950s and 1960s.

name: Tom
comments: Pop music singer Season 1 contestant of Idool (6th place)

name: Stéphanie [BE]
comments: Pop music singer Season 1 contestant of Idool (10th place)

name: Louanne Hogan
comments: Vocalist with many dubbing credits in movies in the 1940s

name: Benny Meroff
comments: Composer and bandleader active in the swing jazz era. He also played violin, clarinet, and saxophone.

name: Catherine Porter
comments: Stage actress and pop singer and songwriter

name: Isha
comments: Jazz and pop vocalist and pianist

name: Jason Antone
comments: House/club music vocalist based in Chicago

name: Care Bears on Fire
comments: Pop-punk trio from Brooklyn, New York

name: Eric Hofbauer
comments: Guitarist and composer based in Boston.

name: Allan Fraser
comments: Contemporary folk guitarist, singer and songwriter.

name: Daisy DeBolt
comments: Multi-instrumentalist, singer and songwriter who started professionally in music in the contemporary folk genre, but later also sang jazz.  DeBolt also wrote scores for the National Film Board of Canada and did some acting.

name: Lester Chambers
aliases: Lester Chambers And The Mud Stompers
Lester Chambers and The Mud Stompers
comments: Blues and soul singer, percussionist and harmonica player

name: David Hartman
comments: Best known as the host of the "Good Morning America" television program. He was an actor from the mid-1960s to the mid-1970s.

name: Henri Betti
comments: Songwriter and pianist. He was very active in creating works for the stage and movies in the 1950s.

name: Jacques Hélian
aliases: Jacques Hélian et son nouvel orchestre
Jacques Hélian et son orchestre avec chœurs
Jacques Hélian et son orchestre avec les chœurs
Jacques Hélian et son orchestre - Chant : Fred Harvey et les chœurs
Jacques Hélian et son orchestre et chœurs
Jacques Hélian son orchestre et les chœurs

name: Joe Albany
comments: Albany was a highly respected jazz pianist whose career was damaged by his decades of heroin addiction and periods in prison.

name: John Campbell [US3]
comments: Jazz pianist born in Bloomington, Illinois

name: Ty Fyffe
comments: Rap/hip hop producer from Queens, New York

name: Luis Rodríguez
comments: Producer, arranger, mixer and engineer, who started in the mid-1970s as a singer, but is mostly known as the co-producer, arranger, mixer and engineer behind the eighties-era euro-disco sound of Modern Talking .

name: Jesper Thilo
comments: Jazz multi-instrumentalist who primarily plays saxophones.

name: Walter Hawkins
aliases: Walter Hawkins & the Love Center Choir
Walter Hawkins and the Love Center Choir
Walter Hawkins and the Love Center Choir ‎

name: Art Lande
comments: Jazz pianist and, since the mid-1990s, jazz drummer. Lande (pronounced Lan-dee) is also a composer and educator.

name: Jack Marshall
aliases: The Guitar Ramblers under the direction of Jack Marshall
comments: Guitarist, composer, conductor and arranger. He composed music for television, including "The Munsters", for which he was nominated for a Grammy.

name: Billy Pierce
comments: Jazz tenor and soprano saxophonist.  He is the chair of the Berklee College of Music's Woodwinds Department.

name: Dean & Britta
comments: Los Angeles based duo active as electro-acoustic musicians as well as soundtrack compilers and score composers

name: The Band of The Yorkshire Imperial Metals
George Wallington
comments: Jazz pianist, composer and leader.  Born in Sicily, his family moved to the United States when he was an infant.

name: Frank Wess
comments: Jazz alto and soprano saxophonist and flautist

name: Brad Goode
comments: Jazz trumpeter and teacher who is currently a professor at the University of Colorado.

name: Stephen Scott
comments: Jazz pianist who primarily plays swing and bop.  Not to be confused with Stephen Scott, the neo-classical composer, probably best known for developing the bowed piano.

name: Monty Budwig
comments: Generally recorded as a sideman, Budwig played double bass.

name: Stan Levey
comments: Jazz drummer born in Philadelphia, Pennsylvania

name: Hendrik Meurkens
aliases: Hendrik Meurkens & New York SambaJazz All-Stars ‎
comments: Born in Germany to Dutch parents, jazz harmonica player and vibraphonist currently living in New York City.

name: Nina [PH]
comments: Singer, songwriter, producer, TV and radio personality

name: The NBC Symphony Orchestra
comments: Orchestra specially constituted by David Sarnoff, chairman of RCA (which owned both RCA Victor Records and NBC radio) for conductor Arturo Toscanini in 1937. Offering the highest salaries of any orchestra at the time and a 52-week contract NBC attracted top orchestral musicians. The orchestra disbanded in 1954

name: Floyd Chance
comments: Legendary country music acoustic bass player.

name: Marc Ellington
comments: Folk-rock and country singer-songwriter, producer and composer.

name: Ricky Morrison
comments: House music DJ and producer; frequent collaborator with Fran Sidoli.

name: Fran Sidoli
comments: House music DJ and producer; a frequent collaborator with Ricky Morrison

name: Daniel Janin
aliases: Daniel Janin, son orchestre et ses chanteurs
Daniel Janin, son orchestre, ses chanteurs
comments: Songwriter, bandleader and vibist. His style ranged from jazz-funk to easy listening pop.

name: Bixio-Frizzi-Tempera
comments: A trio of soundtrack composers (as well as conductors and musicians) who often worked together.

name: The Iguanas [US1]
comments: Garage punk group from Ann Arbor, Michigan that gave Iggy Pop his first recording and his nickname.

name: The Capitol Jazzmen
comments: Ad hoc studio band made up of Capitol jazz artists for their eponymous album.

name: James "Iron Head" Baker
comments: Initially recorded by John Lomax where Baker was serving a 99-year sentence as a habitual offender in a Texas prison, arising from a burglary.  Lomax was able to get him paroled, although Baker returned to prison within a year for a new burglary.

name: Jari Sillanpää
comments: Singer born in Ludvika in Sweden.

name: Terry Howe
comments: Guitarist and composer born in Ohio, later based in Indiana

name: Arne Domnérus
aliases: Arne Domnérus Septet featuring Bengt Hallberg
comments: Played jazz alto saxophone and clarinet.

name: Jordis Unga
comments: Rock singer, songwriter and performer from Minnesota, now based in LA. Finished 5th in a contest for becoming INXS lead singer.

name: Larry Smith [1]
comments: Relatively unknown jazz alto saxophonist based in Detroit, Michigan.

name: Neftali Santiago
comments: Soul, R&B and funk music drummer

name: Linda Creed
comments: Philadelphia-born songwriter, who was inducted in the Songwriters Hall of Fame in 1992. Best known for her soul and disco compositions in the 1970s, in particular by The Stylistics and The (Detroit) Spinners.

name: Marty Coleman
comments: Doo wop singer from Detroit. After The Valadiers broke up Coleman worked as a staff songwriter for Motown under the name Martin Cohen, placing songs with The Spinners, Gladys Knight and The Pips, and others. His biggest hit as a songwriter was The Precisions' "If This Is Love (I'd Rather Be Lonely)", which was issued on Drew Records.

name: Jo Bridges
comments: Soul and R&B songwriter and producer

name: Tom Nixon [US1]
comments: Soul and R&B producer, engineer, songwriter and arranger

name: Gene McDaniels
comments: Smooth vocal pop stylist, songwriter and producer

name: Rick Darnell
comments: Blues musician, songwriter and radio station owner

name: Jackie Mittoo
comments: Toronto, Canada based keyboardist, songwriter and musical director

name: Arthur Baker
aliases: Arthur Baker and the Backbeat Disciples

name: Denzil Miller
comments: Musician, composer, arranger, conductor, musical director

name: Maseo
comments: Hip hop artist, rapper, producer, and DJ.

name: Trugoy the Dove
comments: Hip hop artist, rapper, and producer

name: Teddy Powell
comments: Guitarist, vocalist, composer and big band leader

name: Bobby Sharp
comments: Songwriter, musician, and singer originally from Kansas. Wrote "Unchain My Heart" under his cousin's name, "Agnes Jones".

name: Bill Kreutzmann
comments: Drummer.  Kreutzmann moved to Hawaii after the death of Jerry Garcia.

name: Phil Lesh
aliases: Phil Lesh & The Terrapin Family Band
comments: Bassist and founding member of both Grateful Dead and the extensively touring band Furthur

name: Ornette Coleman
comments: While his primary instrument is alto saxophone, Coleman also plays tenor sax, trumpet and violin.  He is also a composer.  Coleman is credited as one of the originators of free jazz, and also plays free funk, fusion and other jazz styles.  In his middle career, Coleman created the term "harmolodics" to describe his music.

name: June Carter
aliases: June Carter and Her Bashful Rascals
comments: Country singer, musician, songwriter and actress

name: Merle Kilgore
comments: Country music recording artist and songwriter.  He was not particularly successful as a performer, but achieved success and fame as a songwriter.

name: Artie Resnick
comments: Songwriter, record producer and musician born in Brooklyn, NY.

name: Yoko Ono
comments: Performance artist, filmmakerand Fluxus art collective member turning into an expressive singer, musician, songwriter and peace activist

name: Rainer Ptacek
comments: German born guitarist, singer and songwriter performing primarily under the name Rainer. His premature death was caused by a brain tumor.

name: Michael Kunze
comments: Musical theater lyricist and librettist and one of the most successful German lyrics authors for the Schlager genre with twenty-six "Number 1" hits in Germany.

name: Larry Pignagnoli
comments: Composer, musician and record producer Founder of Off Limits SRL

name: Ted White
comments: First husband and former manager of Aretha Franklin, also co-writer of several of her songs.

name: Alan Menken
comments: Musical theatre and film composer, who won many Academy Awards and Grammys among other honors

name: Howard Ashman
comments: Playwright and lyricist. Ashman was a driving force during the early years of the "Disney Renaissance".

name: Mona Carita
comments: One of Finland's most popular disco singers in the late 1970s. She ended her singing career after her fourth album in 1983.

name: The New Orleans Social Club
comments: Six weeks after Hurricane Katrina, a parade of Crescent City legends united to celebrate the indomitable spirit and culture of their native city. Grammy-nominated producer Leo Sacks and multiple Grammy-winning producer/engineer Ray Bardani assembled: Ivan Neville on organ, Henry Butler on piano, and two founding members of The Meters -- Leo Nocentelli on guitar and George Porter, Jr. on bass. Rounding out the quintet was Raymond Weber on drums. Joining the core band were guests including Irma Thomas, Marcia Ball, Dr. John, Willie Tee, Troy (Trombone Shorty) Andrews and John Boutte.

name: Eric Gale
comments: Rhythm and blues influenced jazz guitarist; he only occasionally recorded as a leader, but was a very sought-after session/live musician.

name: Sam Jones
comments: Jazz double bass player, cellist, and composer.  He had the nickname "Home", which was acquired through his habit of calling others "Home".

name: Piet Souer
comments: Guitarist, producer, arranger and songwriter from Eindhoven

name: Luv'
comments: Female pop trio. After the trio's breakup they made several comebacks: 1989–1996, 2005–2012 and since 2016.

name: Dingo [NL]
comments: Disco formation in the late 1970's: Dick Joustra (Dave Dean) en Reinie Ijsseldijk

name: George Russell
comments: Composer, music theorist, educator, and jazz pianist, although he started out as a drummer.  His book, "The Lydian Concept of Tonal Organization" (1953) is generally considered to be the first major contribution in the field of music theory by a jazz musician.

name: Ottawan
comments: Vocal duo in the 1970s and 1980s consisting of Patrick Jean-Baptiste and Annette Etilce.

name: Decoded Feedback
comments: Musical project which incorporates styles of electro-industrial and aggrotech

name: Raphael Ravenscroft
comments: Primarily a saxophonist, he also played flute and french horn. He had primarily recorded as a session player. His greatest fame was for the saxophone solo in Gerry Rafferty's performance of Baker Street .

name: Mesh [GB]
comments: Dark synthpop band based out of Bristol

name: Vi Subversa
comments: Singer and guitarist. She released her first single (with the Poison Girls) at 44 years old and a mother of two.

name: Diego Imbert
comments: French jazz bass player and composer

name: Mark Vincent
comments: Tenor who won the third series of Australia's Got Talent in 2009

name: The Tanner Sisters
aliases: The Tanner Sisters with Rhythm Accompaniment
comments: Vocal duo consisting of sisters Frances and Stella Tanner, who made hundreds of appearances on British radio and television during the 1950s

name: Raffi
comments: Born in Cairo, Egypt, to Armenian parents, Raffi's family emigrated to Canada in 1958.  Raffi started out as a folksinger/singer-songwriter in Toronto, but came to concentrate on music for children.  He is also an author, principally of children's books.

name: Jal Joshua
comments: Singer, appear in the 'Australia’s Got Talent' 2014 season. Immigrated to Australia in 2008.

name: Preservation Hall Jazz Band
comments: Group of fluid membership, founded in the early 1960s and connected with Preservation Hall, a jazz venue in New Orleans.

name: Theresa Andersson
comments: Swedish singer and multi-instrumentalist who moved to New Orleans when she was 18.

name: Magpie
comments: Folk duo, Terry Leonino and Greg Artzner, still active as artists for civil rights

name: Ronnie Carroll
comments: Pop singer from Northern Ireland who represented Great Britain in the Eurovision Song Contest in 1962 and 1963, finishing fourth on both occasions with "Ring-a-Ding Girl" and "Say Wonderful Things" respectively.

name: Lazza
comments: Violinist, keyboard player, singer. arranger and songwriter

name: Beelzebubs
comments: All-male a cappella group from Tufts University, Medford, Massachusetts

name: Rick Gallagher
comments: Jazz pianist and composer based in Pittsburgh, Pennsylvania

name: James Christopher
comments: Blues guitarist and singer based in Wilmington, Maryland

name: Hellsongs
comments: Trio (sometimes quartet) founded in 2004. Mainly replaying very to less acoustic versions of Metal and Hard Rock classics, a style by some called Lounge Metal.
